bulletins.summary: Air systems: blank cabin temp due to lavatory/galley vent fan off on gound
bulletins.description: when lav/galley vent fan off, cabin temperatures show blank.
bulletins.operation: None

bulletins.description: Inability to terminate multiple ATIS, TWIP automatic update requests
bulletins.operation: request only one ATIS-arrival with automatic update. In case the anomaly occurs, to terminate request repeat request for station.

bulletins.description: Nusiance Eicas caution/advisory during external power  starts( messages might include FCTL, Auto Speed brake, spoilers, spoiler pairs)
bulletins.operation: None, message will clear after second engine start

bulletins.description: Nusiance single source approach caution
bulletins.operation: None

bulletins.description: Ground Proximity Nusiance message when flying >250 kts and selecting flap override/gear override
bulletins.operation: None

bulletins.description: Tat voting logic error shows higher/lower tat
bulletins.operation: When using manual anti ice, turn on engine and wing anti ice above 15 degree c.

bulletins.description: Pushing the altitude selector knob causes unexpected altitude changes
bulletins.operation: confirm altitude  is correct when pushing the altitude selector knob

bulletins.summary: Lnav Guidance error in holding pattern(TK)
bulletins.description: LNAV does not follow Hold
bulletins.operation: if airplane descends through 14000, make sure it stays on correct path till first inbound turn. Use Hdg select/trk select to correct path in case of deviation.

bulletins.description: FMC will reset if procedure turn is 28th leg of an active flight plan
bulletins.operation: Don’t' input procedure turn on the 28th leg (p6/l3)

bulletins.description: Tail Strike message may show in flight
bulletins.operation: If Tail strike shows during takeoff, consider message valid. If it shows in flight, consider it as nusiance.

bulletins.summary: Uncommanded Engine shutdown during Landing Roll
bulletins.description: TCMA function shutds down both engines on ground
bulletins.operation: Make sure thrust revers are deployed after touchdown. After touch down, extend speedbrakes and deploy thrust revers without delay

bulletins.summary: (fmc pv3.0/A/B) Fmc reset when exiting hold
bulletins.description: If pilot selects and executes exit hold within 3 degrees of inbound holding leg, and does not execute but selects direct to hold fix, the FMC resets when aircraft  sequences the hold fix. Fligh plan and performance must be reinserted.
bulletins.operation: Don’t' select exit hold, then select direct to hold fix, then sequence the hold fix with route in modified state

bulletins.description: MCP changes without flight crew action
bulletins.operation: If MCP ALT changes, AUTOPILOT, Pitch mode will be degraded. Set the correct alt on MCP, disengage the autopilot, both flight drectors off, engage autopilot and select desired modes, select both FD to ON.

bulletins.summary: VNAV path not available on Final Approach
bulletins.description: If waypoints sequence after the MAP before flying the approach, VNAV PATH will not engage
bulletins.operation: IF waypoint sequences past MAP, Reload approach and enter cruise alt on vnav cruise page before airplane sequences the final approach fix, the cruise altitude must be Greater than the highest altitude contraint in the FPL

bulletins.summary: Additional Guidance on Ice Crystal Icing
bulletins.description: Use of Climb thrust or high trust settings when ice crystal anti-icing function is active
bulletins.operation: avoid mcs (mesoscale convective system,use lateral deviations, relight will relight the a/c incase of flameout)

bulletins.description: RTA does not correctly sequence from crusie to descent. Time RTA manually
bulletins.operation: Be aware

bulletins.description: These engines have experienced Intermediate Pressure Compressor(IPC) rotor fail, affecting ETOPS ops.
bulletins.operation: Different et-ops procedure. review procedures on FCOM Bulletins.

bulletins.description: If approach is loaded prior to departure, if TOGA is pushed after takeoff, unwanted/unexpected AP modes show.
bulletins.operation: Do not load instrument approach until after departure phase of flight

bulletins.description: Changes to fmc
bulletins.operation: Review FCOM

bulletins.summary: Unwanted GLIDESLOPE alert on IAN Approach
bulletins.description: Barometric pressure changes due to temprature can set off Glideslope Alert
bulletins.operation: Make sure correct QNH set, if alert occurs, silence GLIDESLOPE AURAL, Continue on VGSI path or reestablish FMC BASED barometric IAN Glide PATH, transition to visual approach and landing or Go Around

bulletins.description: Premature Climb Thrust Reduction when Thrust reduction point is set to FLAPS 5
bulletins.operation: Don't use FLAPS 5 on Thrust reduction. Use Height

bulletins.description: Due to heating, Fire switch can fail locked or unlocked.
bulletins.operation: If it fails locked, do the appropriate NNC, set fuel control switch to cutoff, set Hydraulic Eng Primary Pump Switch off for the affected side. If failed locked, Engine fire swith can be pulled inadvertently. Caution is advised.

bulletins.description: NGIV may fail in closed postions affecting operation of slats/Flaps/nose gear extension, and nose wheel steering
bulletins.operation: If SLATS_PRIMARY_FAIL shows during approach when slats are in commanded position, move flaps lever to 5. DO the checklists for all messages, plan additional time for alternate gear extension.

bulletins.description: New operating instructions for these engines
bulletins.operation: Alternate ETOPs drift down procedures (review fcom)

bulletins.summary: Erroneous AFDS guidance when ILS signal interference occurs
bulletins.description: AFDS may provide high rates of descent and significant deviation from localizer.
bulletins.operation: Monitor RAW data, call out any significant deviations,, perform go around if not within criteria

bulletins.description: With LOC Captured, aircraft may continue flying through localizer.
bulletins.operation: Monitor Localizer, if anomaly occurs, flight crew must intervene. If not intercepted loc by FAF, Go around.

bulletins.description: after IAN approach, When go around is initiated below 50 feet,

bulletins.summary: Autothrottle fails to disconnect during balked landing
bulletins.description: Autothrottle fails to disconnect when thrust levers are advanced during balked landing
bulletins.operation: If a go-around is initiated after touchdown but before thrust reverser selection, disengage autopilot/autothrottle, smoothly advance thrust levers to go around thrust. Verify speed brakes retract and autobrakes disarm. Maintain landing flap configuration and smoothly rotate towards to a 15 deg go around pitch attitude. once airborne push the TO/GA switch. continue go around procedure.

bulletins.summary: LNAV path deviation from published procedure path
bulletins.description: Potential for LNAV Path deviation from the published procedural path, especially with wayponts closer together than 10 NM. Or with turns of more than 120 degrees. Note that the radiuses of the connected turns are based on the speed calculated at the end of the connected turns.
bulletins.operation: During preflight, if there are waypoints on a sid closer than 10 nm, and course changes greater than 120 degrees, insert a lower climb speed on the vnav clb page or waypoint constraint on legs page that complies with published speed restrictions.

bulletins.description: Autothrottle may increase thrust during flare when the Radio Altimeter is on a 'No computed data' Status. From the 2 radio altimeters, when one fails , the autothrottle  does not reduce thrust to idle but stays in speed mode.
bulletins.operation: Guard Thrust levers and be prepared to disconnect autothrottles as needed.

bulletins.description: Flight Control Electronics changes that might affect flight operations.
bulletins.operation: Review FCOM

bulletins.summary: TCP inoperative and uncommanded Frequency Transfer
bulletins.description: TCPs become inoperative and show message SYSTEM NOT AVAILABLE ON THIS PANEL. Functions like vhf, hf, gpws, wxr, tcas/xpdr, atp function but cannot be controlled until at least one TCP is reset.
bulletins.operation: IF one or two TCPs are inoperative, select each tcp off then on. If  tcp becomes inoperative again , leave it off. If three TCPs are inoperative, select all 3 tcps off, the select only the right TCP on.

bulletins.summary: PACK advisory or PACK L+R caution message can show brieflfy after takeoff or ldg with PCU Y201 Software installed
bulletins.description: Due to conservative logic used to detect operational status of PACKS, PACK advisory may show from liftoff till 1000 feet above airport elevation.
bulletins.operation: It is acceptable to wait upto one minute after the PACK messages show before responding to ensure messages are not due to logic changes with the PCU Y201 software..

bulletins.summary: Generator OFF Light ON After Engine Start With No EICAS Message
bulletins.description: During an engine start if a generator does not reach a minimum frequency of 380Hz the generator will not come on line and the generator OFF light will remain illuminated.
bulletins.operation: After engine start, flight crews should check that the generator OFF lights on the electrical panel are not illuminated. If a generator OFF light is illuminated, maintenance action is required.

bulletins.summary: 777 Fuel Quantity Indicating System Fluctuations or Blanking Due to a Wiring Harness Problem
bulletins.description: 777 operators report FUEL IMBALANCE EICAS advisory messages and/or the fuel quantity display blanking in flight due to fluctuating main and center tank fuel quantity indications. F
bulletins.operation: If the FUEL IMBALANCE EICAS advisory message occurs in flight, check fuel quantity readings to determine if the fuel quantity is fluctuating, or if a true imbalance or fuel leak exists

bulletins.summary: Nuisance Visual and Aural Smoke Alarm Annunciations in Lavatories, Crew Rest Compartments and Other Cabin Compartments
bulletins.description: As a result of environmental regulations and parts obsolescence, ionization smoke detectors installed in the lavatories, crew rest compartments and other cabin compartments were replaced with photoelectric smoke detectors.
bulletins.operation: If any of these indications occur, the cabin crew should follow standardprocedures for smoke detection. If no smoke source is present and the alarm occurred immediately after a power transfer, consider the alarm a nuisance occurrence

bulletins.summary: Nuisance PASSENGER ADDRESS EICAS Status Message
bulletins.description: The Speaker Drive Modules (SDM) check all cabin speaker output ports for open circuits and short circuits each time a chime (fasten seat belts, attendant calls, 10,000 feet, etc.) is sounded in the airplane. In the case of the Passenger Address
bulletins.operation: f the PASSENGER ADDRESS EICAS status message shows before dispatch, itmay be a nuisance message. Instruct the cabin crew to make sure all cabin speakers are working

bulletins.summary: Delayed Release of Landing Gear Lever Lock
bulletins.description: After the initial retraction attempt, crews were able to retract the gear by raising the landing gear lever after a short delay or by accomplishing the Gear Lever Locked Down NNC.
bulletins.operation: If this condition occurs the flight crew should accomplish the Gear Lever Locked Down NNC:

bulletins.summary: System anomalies to be corrected with a future FMC software revision
bulletins.description: Steep Descent Path, Incorrect VNAV Sequencing, Autothrottle Advance When Engaging VNAV on Approac,
bulletins.operation: Review Fcom

bulletins.description: During flight test, following a power interrupt to the Left AC Bus the EICAS Fuel Synoptic page displayed the fuel spar valve as invalid (white circle) and the green fuel flow bars were replaced with white background lines.
bulletins.operation: Anytime there is a power interrupt to the left AC bus, the Fuel Synoptic can giveinvalid indications and should not be used for situational awareness.

bulletins.description: Boeing has been made aware that overly aggressive pitch behavior may occur during altitude capture in VNAV when large changes to the barometric pressur reference are made
bulletins.operation: When in VNAV and capturing an altitude at or near the transition level or transition altitude, select FLCH, V/S or Altitude HOLD prior to making the barometric setting change

bulletins.description: The localizer and glideslope pointers on the PFD are accurate when the ILS frequency is amber with an amber horizontal line.
bulletins.operation: After selecting an ILS approach and when in reception range, verify the ILS is correctly tuned and identified. Identify the ILS after the on side PFD displays the amber frequency. Check for mo

bulletins.description: There are supplementary procedures to follow when flying at gross weights below 154,221 kilograms.
bulletins.operation: Landing distances will be longer due to the higher VREF speed. For  Normallanding, increase the landing distance by 135 meters. For non-normal landing,increase the landing distance by 190 meters. These numbers are conservative and usable for all landing distance tables.

bulletins.summary: Uncommanded Autothrottle Movement on the Ground.
bulletins.description: There have been reports of uncommanded autothrottle advancement during ground operations. The majority of reports have occurred during taxi. In
bulletins.operation: Boeing recommends the pilot flying keeps a hand on the thrust levers as much as possible during ground operations.

bulletins.summary: B777F - CARGO HEAT BULK EICAS Advisory Message
bulletins.description: A 777F experienced a CARGO HEAT BULK EICAS message which was accompanied with an ECS CARD R Status message.
bulletins.operation: If a CARGO HEAT BULK message is shown on a 777F before dispatch, the appropriate DDG and maintenance procedures should be followed. If thismessage occurs after dispatch, the message may be regarded as nuisance.

bulletins.summary: Transient TRANSPONDER EICAS advisory  essage when arming APP on the MCP
bulletins.description: During Boeing flight testing, the EICAS messages TRANSPONDER L and TCAS OFF momentarily showed when the approach mode was armed.
bulletins.operation: The subject condition is considered a transient

bulletins.description: The 777 FMC has a limit of 150 waypoints that may be loaded into a route. If a flight crew attempts to insert more than 150 waypoints into the FMC, a
bulletins.operation: During all phases of flight, flight crew should ensure a maximum of 30 LEGS pages.

bulletins.summary: VNAV Descent on Approach Without a Valid Descent Path
bulletins.description: Boeing has received a report of a VNAV descent on a non-precision approach without a VNAV path after being vectored by ATC.
bulletins.operation: Boeing has received a report of a VNAV descent on a non-precision approach without a VNAV path after being vectored by ATC.

bulletins.summary: Uncommanded Turns When LNAV is in Use
bulletins.description: Boeing has received several reports of uncommanded turns when LNAV is inuse.
bulletins.operation: Avoid executing lateral OFFSET when approaching an active waypoint:  Avoid entry of a vertical or lateral flight planning change when approaching an active waypoint.•

bulletins.summary: Fuel Flow Blanking with GE90-100 Series Engines
bulletins.description: fuel flow indications blanking on GE90-100 seriesengines at or near minimum idle during descent
bulletins.operation: no flight crew action is required

bulletins.summary: Error in Airplane Fuel Quantity Indications
bulletins.description: All fuel quantity indications (EICAS, Fuel Synoptic, etc.) can show a greater fuelquantity than the actual fuel quantity.
bulletins.operation: efore starting the engines, use the final fuel load documentation to verify that the initial airplane fuel, plus the fuel added for the flight, is the same as the total fuel quantity on EICAS.

bulletins.summary: Erroneous Autopilot Flight Director System (AFDS) Guidance whenInstrument Landing System (ILS) Signal Interference Occurs
bulletins.description: veral reports of unexpected pitch guidance when capturing or tracking the glideslope during an instrument landing system (ILS) approach disables one element of the automatic autothrottle disconnect logic
bulletins.operation: While on an ILS approach, monitor localizer and glideslope raw data and call out criteria to continue the approach

bulletins.summary: Autothrottle fails to disconnect during balked landing
bulletins.description: Autothrottle fails to disconnect during balked landing
bulletins.operation: during balked landing, disengage autopilot and autothrottle advancing thrust lever to go around trust, verify speedbrakes retract and autobrakes disarm, maintain landin gflap configuration and rotate 15 degrees ga attitude. Airborne, push toga switch, continue with missed approach procedures.

bulletins.description: The cabin pressurization panel experiences intermittent blanking or dimming, which compromises the visibility of critical cabin pressure information during various phases of flight. This can lead to misinterpretation of pressurization data and potential safety concerns.
bulletins.operation: On ground, do not take off, in flight if panel does not self recover avoid amendments to flight alt and land alt. If change to these is required, for flight, don't do anything. For landing alt, manually control cabin altitude when below 1000 ft msl or 3000 above airport elevation

bulletins.description: When selecting an alternate approach on a Standard Terminal Arrival Route (STAR) with a common waypoint, the FMC displays an incorrect constraint altitude. This miscalculation could lead to altitude deviations during the approach.
bulletins.operation: Manually input the correct altitude into the FMC or recalibrate the FMC constraint function to ensure accurate altitude guidance during STAR approaches.

bulletins.description: A VNAV invalid performance message appears on the scratchpad, disrupting the optimal flight profile execution. This issue interferes with the normal operation of the vertical navigation system.
bulletins.operation: Clear the invalid performance data from the scratchpad and reset the VNAV system. Verify performance inputs and update the system software if necessary.

bulletins.description: After engine start, the Digital Flight Data Recorder (DFDR) briefly illuminates an amber OFF light. This indicates a potential issue with DFDR initialization which, if persistent, could affect the proper recording of flight data.
bulletins.operation: Check the DFDR system’s initialization procedures and verify that all parameters are within the normal operating range. If the amber light persists, conduct further system checks and consult maintenance.

bulletins.description: Oscillations in the bleed air system have been observed, affecting engine performance and potentially causing fluctuations in engine thrust. These oscillations could lead to operational inconsistencies during flight.
bulletins.operation: Use onboard diagnostics to assess the bleed system, adjust system parameters as required, and perform maintenance if persistent oscillations are detected.

bulletins.summary: Approach Data Block Anomaly with GLS Channel Selected
bulletins.description: An anomaly occurs in the approach data block when the GLS channel is selected, resulting in inconsistent approach data being displayed. This can impact the guidance provided during the approach phase.
bulletins.operation: Reset the approach data block configuration, verify the integrity of the GLS channel data, and update the software settings as per the revised procedure.

bulletins.description: During the starter cutout phase, a blinking alert indicates that the START VALVE remains open. This condition could lead to abnormal engine start behavior.
bulletins.operation: Perform a system check on the START VALVE, verify its proper operation, and if necessary, adjust or replace the valve to ensure it closes at the correct time during engine start.

bulletins.summary: (Hot Wxr)Engine Start with High Outside Air Temperature
bulletins.description: Engines may start when the outside air temperature (OAT) is at or above 40°C/104°F, which can affect engine performance and may lead to uncommanded engine behavior during start-up.
bulletins.operation: Monitor engine start closely in high OAT conditions, adjust start parameters if necessary.Turn off Engine pumps before Engine start. set start lever to idle at 20 pc n2.

bulletins.description: Airplanes equipped with the integrated ADIRU (I-ADIRU) experience anomalies in switching to Automatic Navigation Realign (ANR) mode. This affects the accuracy of the navigation system during critical flight phases.
bulletins.operation: Do full Alignment before each flight, or do the fast realignment supplementary procedure. If you don't you might notice effects in 7.5 to 15 mins

bulletins.description: The predictive windshear system exhibits anomalies that can result in inaccurate or delayed windshear warnings. This discrepancy may affect flight crew response during turbulent conditions.
bulletins.operation: Update the predictive windshear software parameters and test the system under simulated conditions to verify the accuracy of the alerts.

bulletins.summary: Lateral Path Exceedance on Course Reversal
bulletins.description: During course reversal maneuvers on approach, the aircraft sometimes exceeds the lateral path limits due to improper FMC calculations. This could lead to unstable approaches.
bulletins.operation: Manually monitor and adjust the heading during course reversal; update the FMC software if necessary to prevent lateral path exceedance.

bulletins.description: The Electronic Engine Control (EEC) system’s pressure sensors are freezing under certain conditions, leading to erroneous engine control signals and potential performance issues.
bulletins.operation: In the event that N1 Oscillations occur, do the engine limit or surge or stall nnc

bulletins.description: A malfunction in the elevator jam landing assist switch can prevent proper landing configuration, potentially compromising the landing performance of the aircraft.
bulletins.operation: Ensure the JAM Assist guard is closed

bulletins.description: Airplanes equipped with Honeywell IMMR 69002600-0101 and certain software versions experience a dual loss of GPS signals. This can significantly degrade navigation performance.
bulletins.operation: On the ground, don't take off. In flight only ground based navaids are available. Terrain alerts are not available. Verify DME Update is on

bulletins.description: When using LNAV mode to intercept the localizer, the aircraft may overshoot the localizer course due to delayed or inaccurate guidance inputs.
bulletins.operation: Adjust LNAV settings to tighten guidance tolerances and monitor localizer capture closely during interception.

bulletins.summary: Radio Altimeter Anomalies Due to 5G Interference
bulletins.description: Radio altimeters are exhibiting anomalies attributed to 5G C-Band wireless broadband interference, resulting in incorrect altitude readings during critical phases of flight.
bulletins.operation: Shield or recalibrate the radio altimeter system, and update interference mitigation protocols as recommended by the manufacturer.

bulletins.description: The datalink system displays a 'FULL' status message unexpectedly, which may hinder the proper transmission of CPDLC messages and other data communications.
bulletins.operation: FMC source select switch Both on R, waith 30 seconds, FMC source select switch Normal.

bulletins.summary: Dual FMC Resets During CPDLC Operations
bulletins.description: Airplanes equipped with FMC U14/U14.1 and FANS 1/2 experience unexpected dual resets during CPDLC operations, interrupting flight management functionality.
bulletins.operation: Wait one minute to allow FMCS to reset, then select an active waypoint. Don't press the ATC function key. Do dual FMC fail NNC if you judge it to be needed.

bulletins.description: The system issues an unwanted glideslope advisory during approaches on airplanes equipped with the IAN option, which can confuse flight crews and affect approach stability.
bulletins.operation: Use the correct barometric settings (QNH).

bulletins.description: A malfunction in the R1 engine anti-ice system can lead to improper activation, potentially affecting engine performance and safety during icy conditions.
bulletins.operation: Don't opeate EAI in flight when not in actual or anticipated icing conditions

bulletins.summary: Wing Anti-Ice Valve Light Nuisance Illumination
bulletins.description: The wing anti-ice valve lights illuminate spuriously, even when the anti-ice system is operating normally, causing unnecessary crew distraction.
bulletins.operation: If above fl 230, wait 20 seconds after illuminations, if they continue illuminating ( the L valve and R valve) do the wing anti-ice L/r nnc.Below fl 230 just do the NNC

bulletins.description: The cowl valve lights intermittently illuminate without an actual fault, potentially misleading the crew about system status.
bulletins.operation: If above fl 230, wait 20 seconds after illuminations, if they continue illuminating (Cowl Valve Lights) do the wing anti-ice L/r nnc.Below fl 230 just do the NNC.

bulletins.description: Following a conditional waypoint (VECTOR) entry, some airplanes experience dual FMC resets that disrupt flight planning and navigation.
bulletins.operation: The exception occurs when conditional (VECTOR) is active, followed by route discontinuity, followed by waypoint with RNP. Remove any of these and you aresafe.  Do the NNC if FMC Resets.

bulletins.summary: Unexpected Roll Command during RNP Approaches
bulletins.description: When operating with an RNP of 0.3 or below, an unexpected roll command may be generated, affecting lateral stability during the approach phase.
bulletins.operation: Use of autopilot A prevents RAM crossloads from impacting approach procedures. If using autopilot B, be aware that a roll might develop.

bulletins.description: A new alert warns crews of conditions that could lead to severe engine damage by detecting sensor anomalies and abnormal engine parameters that precede damage.
bulletins.operation: The presense of smoke in flight deck or cabin during engine failure should be treated as an engine severe damage. Don oxygen masks, do the NNC and do the somoke fire or fumes NNC

bulletins.description: If a landing runway is not selected or available in the FMC, the Overrun Warning (ORW) system may restrict normal operation, leading to delayed warnings and potential runway overruns.
bulletins.operation: Ensure a landing runway is correctly selected in the FMC and adjust the ORW system parameters to remove unnecessary restrictions.

bulletins.summary: Cockpit Voice Recorder Test Procedure Update
bulletins.description: An update to the cockpit voice recorder (CVR) test procedure is required to prevent accidental erasure of recorded data during testing, ensuring accurate data retention.
bulletins.operation: Follow the updated CVR test procedure which limits test duration and confirms proper recorder operation without erasing critical data.

bulletins.description: The Cabin Pressurization Panel intermittently flickers, dims, or blanks, compromising the crew's ability to read critical cabin pressure information and potentially affecting safety.
bulletins.operation: Reset the panel by cycling its power, perform diagnostic tests, and if the issue persists, follow maintenance procedures to repair or replace the display.

bulletins.summary: Incorrect FMC Constraint Altitude on STAR
bulletins.description: When an alternate approach is selected on a STAR with a common waypoint, the FMC displays an incorrect constraint altitude, risking altitude deviations during approach.
bulletins.operation: Manually verify and input the correct altitude or recalibrate the FMC’s constraint function.

bulletins.description: A VNAV invalid performance message appears on the scratchpad, disrupting the optimal flight profile by interfering with vertical navigation system operations.
bulletins.operation: Clear the invalid performance data and reset VNAV; verify performance inputs and update software if necessary.

bulletins.description: After engine start, the Digital Flight Data Recorder briefly displays an amber OFF light, indicating a potential initialization issue that might affect data recording.
bulletins.operation: Check DFDR initialization procedures and parameters; if the issue persists, perform further system checks and consult maintenance.

bulletins.description: Oscillations in the bleed air system have been observed, leading to fluctuations in engine thrust and operational inconsistencies.
bulletins.operation: Use onboard diagnostics to assess the bleed system, adjust parameters as needed, and perform maintenance if oscillations continue.

bulletins.summary: Approach Data Block Anomaly with GLS Channel Selected
bulletins.description: An anomaly occurs when the GLS channel is selected, resulting in inconsistent approach data that may impact approach guidance.
bulletins.operation: Reset the approach data block configuration, verify GLS channel data integrity, and update software settings per the revised procedure.

bulletins.description: The master caution system intermittently malfunctions and triggers false alerts, potentially distracting the crew.
bulletins.operation: Reset the master caution system and replace or recalibrate any faulty components.

bulletins.summary: Nuisance Stall Warning Stick Shaker Events
bulletins.description: There are reports of nuisance stall warning stick shaker activations, especially under turbulent conditions, which may lead to unnecessary pilot workload.
bulletins.operation: Limit bank angles and adjust operational procedures to mitigate the occurrence of false stall warnings.

bulletins.description: The predictive windshear system displays anomalies that cause inaccurate or delayed warnings, which could affect timely crew response during turbulence.
bulletins.operation: Update the windshear system’s software parameters and test under simulated conditions to ensure accurate alerts.

bulletins.summary: NPS Scales Mask ILS/GLS Fail Flags
bulletins.description: Failures in the ILS/GLS components may be masked by the Navigation Performance Scales, preventing proper display of localizer and glideslope fail flags.
bulletins.operation: Monitor the affected displays and follow the recommended procedures for recognizing masked failure indications.

bulletins.description: A bulletin addressing issues with flap lever operation has been cancelled after resolution or modification of the procedure.
bulletins.operation: No action required; bulletin is cancelled.

bulletins.description: The pressurization panel intermittently blanks or dims, compromising the visibility of critical cabin pressure information.
bulletins.operation: Reset the panel, perform diagnostic tests, and if necessary, follow maintenance procedures to repair or replace the panel.

bulletins.summary: Incorrect FMC Constraint Altitude on STAR
bulletins.description: When selecting an alternate approach on a STAR with a common waypoint, the FMC displays an incorrect constraint altitude that may lead to altitude deviations.
bulletins.operation: Manually verify and correct the altitude constraint in the FMC or recalibrate the system.

bulletins.summary: ADIRU Position Drift and Ground Speed Errors
bulletins.description: Airplanes with the specified ADIRU experience position drift, resulting in inaccurate ground speed and navigation errors.
bulletins.operation: Perform a system check and recalibrate or update the ADIRU as necessary.

bulletins.summary: Descent Below Glide Slope During Approach
bulletins.description: Some 737NG airplanes descend below the glide slope during approach due to FCC software issues, potentially affecting landing performance.
bulletins.operation: Monitor descent profiles closely and adjust approach procedures to maintain proper glide slope.

bulletins.summary: Arming VNAV on the Ground (FMC Update U10.7)
bulletins.description: This bulletin addresses procedures for arming VNAV on the ground, ensuring the FMC is updated to prevent anomalies during VNAV operation.
bulletins.operation: Follow the updated VNAV arming procedure to ensure correct FMC operation on the ground.

bulletins.summary: Unintentional FMC Engine Out Mode Initiation
bulletins.description: The FMC may unintentionally enter the engine out mode (ENG OUT) when using update U10.7, disrupting normal flight management.
bulletins.operation: Monitor FMC behavior closely; if unintended mode initiation occurs, reset the FMC and follow the revised CPDLC procedures.

bulletins.summary: FMC Lockup with SID Selection on Missed Approach
bulletins.description: When a Standard Instrument Departure is selected during a missed approach, the FMC may lock up, affecting flight management.
bulletins.operation: Follow the prescribed reset procedures for the FMC and update the system as recommended.

bulletins.summary: FMC Missed Approach Altitude Constraint Issue
bulletins.description: The FMC applies an incorrect altitude constraint (above 10,000 ft MSL) during missed approaches, potentially affecting approach planning.
bulletins.operation: Manually adjust the missed approach procedures and verify altitude constraints in the FMC.

bulletins.summary: Cabin Altitude Warning Indications and Procedures Update
bulletins.description: Updated procedures and indications for cabin altitude warnings have been issued to ensure accurate crew briefing and response.
bulletins.operation: Review the updated cabin altitude warning procedures and ensure all crew members are briefed on the changes.

bulletins.description: An anomaly in the GPWS minimums voice callout may result in premature or delayed warnings during approach.
bulletins.operation: Avoid rotating the Minimums Reference Selector below 1000 feet AGL and monitor GPWS callouts carefully.

bulletins.description: Display anomalies in the GPWS look-ahead system result in inaccurate terrain alerting, potentially affecting approach decisions.
bulletins.operation: Verify terrain data prior to final approach and use backup procedures if discrepancies are noted.

bulletins.description: The autobrake system may activate inadvertently during landing rollout due to over-rotation of the autobrake select switch.
bulletins.operation: Disarm the autobrake system manually before landing and verify proper brake operation.

bulletins.description: During inflight engine starts, the Exhaust Gas Temperature (EGT) display may not function correctly, risking exceedance of start limits.
bulletins.operation: Monitor EGT readings during inflight starts and ensure they remain within safe limits.

bulletins.description: The Primary Warning System (PWS) may fail to annunciated correctly, potentially masking important warnings.
bulletins.operation: Follow the prescribed checklist for verifying PWS functionality and use backup alerts as necessary.

bulletins.description: Fault indications from the Primary System Electronics Unit (PSEU) appear erroneously, which could mislead crew about system status.
bulletins.operation: Review fault indications, update software if needed, and adhere to contingency procedures.

bulletins.summary: Lateral Path Exceedance on Approach with Course Reversal
bulletins.description: During course reversal maneuvers on approach, the aircraft sometimes exceeds lateral path limits due to improper FMC calculations.
bulletins.operation: Manually monitor heading and adjust as necessary; update FMC software to improve lateral guidance.

bulletins.description: In configurations with CDS BP15 and FMC U12 or newer installed, all six display units may blank unexpectedly, causing temporary loss of critical flight information.
bulletins.operation: Reset the display systems and verify that all units are functioning normally; consult maintenance if the issue persists.

bulletins.description: A software anomaly in the HUD results in degraded display performance or inaccuracies, potentially affecting flight crew situational awareness.
bulletins.operation: Update the HUD software to the latest version and verify display performance during critical phases of flight.

bulletins.description: The aural alert for low airspeed is triggered incorrectly under certain conditions, which may lead to misinterpretation of airspeed status.
bulletins.operation: Monitor airspeed closely and update the alert system to ensure warnings are accurate and timely.

bulletins.summary: Impact of Automatic Approaches with Fail-Operational Autoland
bulletins.description: Automatic approach execution in 737NG airplanes with the fail-operational autoland option may be adversely affected, particularly during ILS approaches at specific airports.
bulletins.operation: Follow corrective procedures provided in the bulletin and update autoland software as recommended.

bulletins.summary: Impact of Arming VNAV on the Ground on Windshear Escape Maneuver
bulletins.description: Arming VNAV on the ground may negatively affect the windshear escape maneuver, potentially reducing the aircraft’s ability to avoid hazardous windshear conditions.
bulletins.operation: Adopt the updated VNAV arming procedure to minimize windshear escape issues.

bulletins.summary: FMC Restarts from ATS/AOC Datalink Issues
bulletins.description: FMC restarts caused by ATS or AOC datalink issues can disrupt flight management operations and data transmission.
bulletins.operation: Log off the problematic datalink system and reset the FMC; follow the revised procedure to mitigate restarts.

bulletins.summary: Localizer Overshoot on LNAV Interception (Fail Operational)
bulletins.description: The aircraft may overshoot the localizer when using LNAV mode to intercept it, particularly in fail operational scenarios with Rockwell Collins FCC 9.0 or 11.1 or newer.
bulletins.operation: Adjust LNAV settings and closely monitor localizer interception; follow updated procedures to minimize overshoot.

bulletins.summary: Localizer Overshoot on LNAV Interception (Fail Passive)
bulletins.description: For airplanes with a fail passive configuration and Rockwell Collins FCC 11.1 or newer, LNAV interception may result in localizer overshoot.
bulletins.operation: Modify LNAV parameters for passive operation and monitor approach for proper localizer capture.

bulletins.summary: Radio Altimeter Anomalies Due to 5G Interference
bulletins.description: Radio altimeter readings are affected by 5G C-Band wireless broadband interference, leading to incorrect altitude information during critical flight phases.
bulletins.operation: Recalibrate or shield the radio altimeter system and update interference mitigation protocols.

bulletins.description: The datalink system displays a FULL status message unexpectedly, which can hinder CPDLC and other communications.
bulletins.operation: Clear the datalink status, verify system parameters, and update the software to ensure continuous data flow.

bulletins.summary: Dual FMC Resets During CPDLC Operations
bulletins.description: Airplanes equipped with FMC U14/U14.1 and FANS 1 or 2 experience dual FMC resets during CPDLC operations, interrupting flight management functions.
bulletins.operation: Reset the FMC, update CPDLC software, and monitor for further resets; implement the revised CPDLC procedures if issues persist.

bulletins.description: A malfunction with the flap lever operation has been identified, which could lead to misconfigurations during critical phases of flight.
bulletins.operation: Inspect the flap lever, adjust or repair as necessary, and verify proper operation before flight.

bulletins.summary: Dual FMC Resets After a Conditional Waypoint
bulletins.description: Following the entry of a conditional waypoint (VECTOR), some airplanes experience dual FMC resets that disrupt navigation and flight planning.
bulletins.operation: Update FMC software to handle conditional waypoints more robustly and monitor for further resets.

bulletins.summary: Unexpected Roll Command during RNP Approaches
bulletins.description: When operating with an RNP of 0.3 or below, an unexpected roll command may occur, affecting lateral stability during the approach phase.
bulletins.operation: Recalibrate the flight control system’s roll parameters and conduct validation tests during RNP approaches.
